basics.name: Julian Brown
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Highly motivated software engineer with experience writing software in Go, Java, and C++. Also experienced in building fast, responsive, and accessible websites using core web technologies. A self-starter and passionate about DevOps, developer productivity, high-performance software, and distributed systems.

work.summary: Building secure interfaces between engineers and AWS, IaC abstractions, and control planes for infrastructure change management.
highlights: Reduced Reyes follower P99 runtime by 90%, allowing cross-region security group (firewall) rules to propagate within 2-3 minutes, improving the stability of distributed systems that depend on cross-region traffic.

Built a safe and secure interface to AWS (Space Station) allowing the Infra Platform team to remove AWS credentials from most Stripe laptops. This allows for the enforcement security invariants on 99.5% of all AWS modifications, improving Stripe's security posture.
Implemented a heuristic to determine affected Terraform module tests, reducing P90 CI times by 60% and saving $2.7 million each year.
Replaced the heuristic with custom Bazel rules for Terraform, and led the migration to build and test all Terraform code with Bazel.
Moved Stripe to a new AWS region with zero downtime
Wrote a codemod to migrate thousands of Terraform modules from v0.11.5 to v0.13.7 within a few weeks, and added support for modern Terraform versions.
Designed and led 5 new Stripe engineers to build a tool to attach Terraform plans to pull requests automatically.
Mentored and coached 2 interns as part of our DEI mentorship program that then converted to full time

work.summary: Infrastructure SME/Lead for the Consulting Team
highlights: Lead the migration of the build system for Consulting Engineering's Go monorepo from Make to Bazel, reducing CI/CD time by 80%.
Designed and built a monitoring and alerting system using Go, Prometheus, and Alertmanager for 600+ plus Pages sites, ETLs, and Jenkins jobs.
Improved developer productivity by building a CI tool to serve pull requests for Yext Pages sites using Go, Docker, Nginx, and Jenkins.
Wrote file system libraries with unit and integration tests in C as part common flight software libraries used by other teams.
Modeled embedded components for the Cygnus Spacecraft in C++ for SITL and HITL simulation testing.

work.summary: Various undergraduat research projects with the the Virginia Tech Aerospace Engineering department
highlights: Impedance Based Structural Health Monitoring Of Hybrid ZnO Smart Composites (Pi: Dr. Philen).
Utilization Of Wind Tunnel With Porous Flexible Wall For Aerodynamic Measurement (Pi. Dr. Devenport).
Modeling of a Hall Effect thruster using C++ (FA. Dr. Srinivasan).
Study of perturbations generated by stratified incompressible thermo-hydrodynamics (PI. Dr. Paterson).
